frame.name: FR_Influence_of_event_on_cognizer-Subjective_influence
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Situation</fen> or an <fen>Entity</fen> has an influence on a <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s volition: it may be manifested in the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s engaging in an <fen>Action</fen> as a consequence of the influence; or the <fen>Cognizer</fen> may be influenced in how they carry out an <fen>Activity</fen> that they might be engaged in already. The influence is NOT a change in emotional state (covered by the Experiencer_obj frame). <ex></ex>
The mediation of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s psyche distinguishes this frame from the Objective_influence frame, where dependent events occur automatically given the appropriate kind of influencing force. In this frame, by contrast, a <fen>Cognizer</fen> may perceive an influence yet not respond to it in any way.
<ex> <fex name="ent">These works</fex> had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> <fex name="cog">her</fex> <fex name="beh">in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region</fex>.</ex> <ex>I'm sure if I asked Mattel <fex name="sit">what</fex> <t>inspired</t> <fex name="pro">this car</fex> I would be told it's an original design, and not supposed to represent any actual car.</ex>
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Attempt_suasion.to_do</frframe>: in FR_Attempt_suasion.to_do, a sentient being voluntarily seeks to convince (FR_Attempt_suasion.to_do) the Cognizer to engage in an Action. With FR_Influence_of_event_on_cognizer-Subjective_influence, the Cognizer undergoes an influence pushing them toward a course of Action or an Activity modification. The Cognizer is necessarily influenced, pushed toward the course of Action or change in Activity, but might end up not performing said Action.
<ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Cognizer_affecting.to_do</frframe>: in FR_Cognizer_affecting.to_do, an eventuality or entity causes the Cognizer to perform some Action. With FR_Influence_of_event_on_cognizer-Subjective_influence, the Cognizer undergoes an influence that pushes them toward a course of Action, but might end up not performing said Action.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Contingency-Objective_influence</frframe>: In FR_Contingency-Objective_influence, the influence impacts anything but a Cognizer (but it can be an action performed by a Cognizer).
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>Experiencer_obj</frframe>: Experiencer_obj describes cases in which the influence concerns some emotional state of the Cognizer. LUs which might fit into FR_Influence_of_event_on_cognizer-Subjective_influence's definition but do not allow for an Action or Activity to be locally realized evoke Experiencer_obj.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : this frame results from the merging of fndata-1.5's Subjective_influence and Influence_of_event_on_cognizer. Cognizer FEs of both frames are merged, and the same goes for the FEs Action and Situation. Subjective_influence's Behavior and Influence_of_event_on_cognizer's Activity are merged into Activity, Subjective_influence's Entity and Influence_of_event_on_cognizer's Protagonist are merged into Entity, and Subjective_influence's Agent and Product don't exist in this frame.
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>, whose mind is moved in the direction of change.
<ex>George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that <t>influenced</t> <fex name="cog">Reagan</fex>. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="sit">The balmy temperatures</fex> <t>inspired</t> me to write a poem on the advent of spring.</ex> <ex>Hecker said that although <fex name="sit">the sheer age of the building</fex> <t>inspired</t> him to preserve its heritage aspects he also designed its interiors around the ·clean and fresh· mood of Queensland.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">The painting</fex> <t>inspired</t> me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>What factors <t>influenced</t> Nixon <fex name="act">to issue the doctrine</fex>?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> might be engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what <t>influenced</t> him <fex name="beh">in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women</ex></def-root>

frameRelation.type: Relation to FN1.5: Is Merged from
